definition: to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste
to get rid of/to remove/to exclude/to eliminate/to wipe out/to divide/except/not including

sentences.english: Slavery was abolished in the United States after the Civil War.
sentences.chinese: 美国的奴隶制度自南北战争后就废除了。

sentences.english: The slavery was overthrown after the Civil War in U.S.A.
sentences.chinese: 在南北战争结束之后，美国的奴隶制被废除了。

sentences.english: We have abolished the system of exploitation of man by man.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经彻底废除了人剥削人的制度。

sentences.english: At first, many of the townsmen were opposed to the abolition of slavery.
sentences.chinese: 起初，许多住在城里的人反对废除奴隶制度。

sentences.english: It was only in 1967 that the United States finally struck down its anti miscegenation laws.
sentences.chinese: 直到1967年，美国才废除了反种族通婚的法律。

sentences.english: One of the first conditions as a result of the Armistice was the complete abrogation of the treaty.
sentences.chinese: 第一个条件，由于停战协定的，是完全废除该条约。

sentences.english: The grand jury has been abolished in England and in approximately one-half of the states in the U. S.
sentences.chinese: 大陪审团在英国以及美国大部分州已经被废除了。

sentences.english: Compulsion in the area of family welfare must be ruled out for all times to come.
sentences.chinese: 在家庭福利方面的强制必须及时废除。

sentences.english: One reason is government direct subsidies to farmers and the abolishment of agricultural taxes.
sentences.chinese: 政府直接补贴农民和废除农业税。

sentences.english: Germany, Sweden and Serbia have scrapped it within the past year, following Italy, Spain and Poland earlier in the decade.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，意大利，西班牙，波兰首先废除了兵役制度。

sentences.english: The company's contract with the city was rescinded in January.
sentences.chinese: 该公司与底特律市的合约在1月份被废除。

sentences.english: The abolition of capitalism and landlordism in Cuba represented an enormous step forward.
sentences.chinese: 古巴对资本主义和地主制度的废除是一个很大的进步。

sentences.english: It was urged that slavery (should) be abolished.
sentences.chinese: 人们力言应废除奴隶制度。

sentences.english: Was he the first president to pass laws to stop slavery?
sentences.chinese: 他是第一个颁布法律废除奴隶制度的总统吗？

sentences.english: And a clutch of counter-terrorism laws that were widely abused under Mr Mubarak will be revoked.
sentences.chinese: 一些在穆巴拉克执政期间广泛滥用的反恐法也将废除。

sentences.english: Decades elapsed between successful abolitionism and New Deal reforms.
sentences.chinese: 几十年过去了之间的成功废除主义和新政改革。

definition: to repeal (a law)/to put an end to/abolition/annulled
to issue/to proclaim/to enact (laws, decrees etc)
to put into effect/to carry out
to dismiss from office/to ban/to reject
to put in place/to put into practice/to take effect
